src:
Pemerintah Mau Bangun 1.500 Km Tol, Jasa Marga 'Kecipratan'?
05 Nov 2019, 13:00 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Foto: Kementerian PUPR

Jakarta - Pemerintah masih memfokuskan pembangunan infrastruktur jalan di lima tahun ke depan. Bahkan, jalan tol menjadi prioritas pembuatan jalan dalam lima tahun.Lantas, sebagai salah satu operator jalan tol terbesar di Indonesia apakah Jasa Marga akan menggarap proyek baru, setidaknya untuk tahun depan?Direktur Keuangan Jasa Marga Donny Arsal menyebutkan bahwa pihaknya masih akan fokus untuk menyelesaikan proyek-proyek yang sudah berjalan. Menurutnya, belum ada tender proyek baru ataupun penugasan baru dari pemerintah untuk Jasa Marga."Government belum tender-in, belum ada penugasan baru juga, maka kita fokus aja selesaikan proyek. Masih ada Cengkareng-Kunciran-Serpong-Cinere, terus Japek Selatan, Probowangi juga, kita fokus dulu sama yang ada," ucap Donny di Hotel Mulia, Selasa (5/11/2019).Sebelumnya, Wakil Menteri PUPR John Wempy Wetipo mengatakan berdasarkan Visium PUPR 2030 dalam lima tahun ke depan, pemerintah akan membangun 1.500 km jalan tol, 2.500 km jalan baru dan 60.000 m jembatan baru/flyover. Dapat disimpulkan, pembangunan jalan tol hingga 2024 akan lebih digenjot.Kembali ke Donny, dari data yang dipaparkannya di sekitar Jabodetabek sendiri ada enam proyek jalan tol yang tengah digarap Jasa Marga. Dua diantaranya ditarget selesai akhir tahun ini, yaitu ruas Kunciran-Serpong sepanjang 11,19 km dan Jakarta-Cikampek Layang sepanjang 36,40 km.Selain itu, Jasa Marga juga tengah menyelesaikan tol Bogor Ring Road sepanjang 11 km, kini konstruksinya sudah mencapai 69,48%. Ada juga tol Jakarta-Cikampek Selatan dengan panjang 64 km, pembangunannya baru 3,91%.Selanjutnya ada juga pembangunan tol yang masuk ke dalam skema JORR II yaitu Cengkareng-Kunciran, Kunciran-Serpong, dan Serpong Cinere. Dari tiga ruas tersebut baru Kunciran-Serpong yang sudah jadi, sedangkan Cengkareng-Kuningan sepanjang 14,19 km baru 63,87% dan Serpong-Cinere sepanjang 10,14 km baru 69,66%.Berikutnya, di Jawa Timur ada dua proyek yang dikebut Jasa Marga yaitu ruas Pandaan-Malang sepanjang 37,62 km dengan progress konstruksi 97,76%, ruas ini sudah dibuka secara fungsional. Selanjutnya, ada juga Probolinggo-Banyuwangi sepanjang 172,9 km yang belum dimulai konstruksinya.Di luar Pulau Jawa, Jasa Marga memiliki proyek jalan tol pertama di Pulau Kalimantan, yaitu ruas Balikpapan-Samarinda. Jalan tol yang melintang sepanjang 99,35 km ini akan dibuka akhir tahun.Terakhir, di Pulau Sulawesi Jasa Marga tengah menyelesaikan proyek tol di ruas Manado-Bitung dengan panjang 39 km. Hingga kini pembangunannya sudah mencapai 52,06%.Simak Video " Menilik Jalan Tol Pertama di Kalimantan"[Gambas:Video 20detik](zlf/zlf)
text:
Government Want to Build 1,500 Km Toll, Jasa Marga 'Splashed'?
05 Nov 2019, 13:00 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Photo: Ministry of PUPR

Jakarta - The government is still focusing on developing road infrastructure in the next five years. In fact, toll roads have become a priority for road construction in five years. Traffic, as one of the largest toll road operators in Indonesia, is Jasa Marga going to work on new projects, at least for next year? Jasa Marga Finance Director Donny Arsal said that it would still focus on completing projects that are already running. According to him, there has been no new project tender or new assignment from the government for Jasa Marga. "The government has not been tender-in, there has been no new assignment, so we will focus on completing the project. There are still Cengkareng-Kunciran-Serpong-Cinere, then South Japek, Probowangi also, we focus first on what is there, "said Donny at Hotel Mulia, Tuesday (11/5/2019). Previously, Deputy Minister of PUPR John Wempy Wetipo said that based on the PUPR 2030 Vision in the next five years, the government will build 1,500 km toll roads, 2,500 km of new roads and 60,000 m of new bridges / flyovers. It can be concluded, the construction of toll roads until 2024 will be further boosted. Back to Donny, from the data he explained around Jabodetabek itself there are six toll road projects that are being worked on by Jasa Marga. Two of them are targeted for completion by the end of this year, namely the Kunciran-Serpong section with a length of 11.19 km and Jakarta-Cikampek Layang along the 36.40 km. In addition, Jasa Marga is also completing the Bogor Ring Road toll for 11 km, now the construction has reached 69 48%. There is also the Jakarta-Cikampek Selatan toll road with a length of 64 km, the construction is only 3.91%. Furthermore, there is also the construction of toll roads that are included in the JORR II scheme, namely Cengkareng-Kunciran, Kunciran-Serpong, and Serpong Cinere. Of the three sections, only Kunciran-Serpong has been made, while Cengkareng-Kuningan with a length of 14.19 km is only 63.87% and Serpong-Cinere along with 10.14 km is only 69.66%. Next, in East Java there are two projects that accelerated Jasa Marga namely the 37.62 km Pandaan-Malang section with 97.76% construction progress, this section has been functionally opened. Furthermore, there is also Probolinggo-Banyuwangi along 172.9 km of which construction has not yet begun. Outside Java, Jasa Marga has the first toll road project on Kalimantan Island, the Balikpapan-Samarinda section. The toll road that runs along the 99.35 km will be opened by the end of the year. Finally, on Sulawesi Island Jasa Marga is completing a toll road project on the Manado-Bitung section with a length of 39 km. Until now the construction has reached 52.06%. Watch Video "Viewing the First Toll Road in Kalimantan" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (zlf / zlf)
